text: Here's how to use Microsoft OneNote.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip through different
parts of this tutorial.
To create a new notebook,
click on plus "Add notebook."
A pop-up will appear.
Click on plus "New,"
then select your notebook color of choice.
Then type in the name of your project.
Let's say you're going on a trip.
We'll call this "Trip."
Then click "Create."

In your notebook, you
can create a section.

This is a folder that will
contain all your pages of notes.

You'll see this colored file
under your new notebook.

Rename your first
section by right-clicking
on "New Section 1," and click "Rename."

You can add as many sections
as you want to your project.

Just click "Add section"
at the bottom of the page

and then type in what
you'd like to call it.
Under each section, you can add pages.
This is where you'll make your notes
and have all your notebook information.

One will be created
automatically under each section.

You can rename this by
typing above the date.

To add another page, click
on one of the sections
and then "Add page" button.
If you have a large notebook,
your sections may not be enough
to organize your pages properly.
You can break down your sections again
by adding subsections.
To do this, you'll need to add a new page
and then convert it into a subsection.

Right-click on that page
and then "New Page."

Right-click on the page
that you just created
and select "Make Subpage."
This will turn it into a subsection.
Now you have your working page
and can start to make notes.
Simply click on the page and start typing.

You can move text around
by clicking on the text

and dragging it to the
desired location on the page.
You can also add visual links
or other information to your page.
From the top menu, click "Insert"

and select whatever you'd
like to add to your notes.
Let's say you want to add a picture.
Click "Picture,"
select the photo you want,
then click "Insert."
If you want to upload a web link,

go to top menu and click
"Insert," then "Link."
In the box, paste the link
you want to include on your notes.

As long as you're
connected to the internet,

you can click this and go
straight to the web page.
Tags help you prioritize notes.
You can mark text as important
or remind yourself to carry out an action.

To do this, highlight
the notes on your page
and then go to the tags section,

located at the right
side of the home menu.
To highlight or mark up notes,

highlight the section
and select the right tool
from the tags drop-down menu.
Let's change these notes into a checklist
by clicking on "To Do."
You can scan and upload documents

directly from your phone
on the OneNote app.
Launch the OneNote app on your device

and go to the page you want
to add the document to.
Hold your finger down on the screen,
and a menu will pop up.

Click on the camera icon and
then select "Take Picture."

Select the document option
and then press "Done."

The picture will appear
on your notes page.

Go to the page you want
to leave an audio note on,
press your finger on the screen,

and select the microphone
icon from the menu.
This will start the recording.

Once you are finished,
click "Stop Recording."
Your voice note will appear on the screen.

You can operate OneNote using
a stylus on your tablet.

First, open OneNote on
your iPad or tablet.

You'll need to have the
application installed.

Make sure that your stylus
is synced to your device.
At the top menu, select "Draw,"
and then you'll be able to draw directly
onto the page with your stylus.

If you want to switch
back to the text mode,
click on the icon at the top menu.

"Text Mode" is on the
left side of your screen,
while the draw mode is on the right.
If you want to draw shapes,

click on the shapes
tool from the top menu.
If your drawing comes out wonky,

OneNote will recognize it
and correct it automatically.

To arrange text, click
on the lasso select tool

and drag the text to the
desired location of the page.
You can use the immersive reading feature
to have notes read back to you.
On the top menu, select "View"
and then "Immersive Reading."
Everything on the screen will blank out
except for the text.
Then click on the play icon,
activate the voice feature,

and you'll hear your notes
being read back to you.

Remember to check that
your volume is turned up.

Click on the share tool on
the far right of the screen.

This will allow you to share
your notebook with others.

From the drop-down menu, click
"Invite People to Notebook."
Type in the contact of the person
you want to share your notes with,
and then click on the share box.
If you'd like them to be able to edit,
click the edit box here,
then complete by clicking "Share."
